website_summaries.verdict: Powerful UV light and a 1-acre radius make this zapper from Flowtron a workhorse for your outdoors.
pros: UV right and electrified grid work to eradicate pests outside
Unit is waterproof and designed not to clog

customer_reviews.title: The 1 acre units are not like the 1/2 acre. Weaker design.
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 1 acre units now being shipped. After getting a 1/2 acre size that worked very well, I wanted the larger grid size of the 1 acre. The 1 acre units are not as durable as the 1/2 acre units. The 1/2 acre units have a metal roof that the electrical grid attaches too. They changed the 1 acre units to a plastic roof that the grid bolts too. There is no support for the grid at the bottom, and thru the normal shocks of shipping, the grid breaks the plastic mounting points. Amazon has shipped me 4 units the past week, and all of them where broke upon receiving. Boxes look fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good news Bad news
customer_reviews.text: This zapper worked fabulously for about 20 to 30 minutes... then it was full and shut off. No more zapping bugs until it is cleaned off. With bugs flying everywhere last night, I didn’t dare go outside to clean it. This is what it looked like when I cleaned it this morning. It does a fine job, but for only a few minutes, then it’s full and shuts off until you clean it again. This is not feasible for me since I live in the country with plenty of bugs at night. I cleaned it by blowing the dead bugs off with a can of air.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Died in under 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were good but mine died in under 6 months. It seemed to work at first and originally I was happy with the purchase. Until the first rain storm. Every time it rains the unit would go crazy zapping each drop of water. How convenient is it to run outside in the rain to unplug your bug zapper?? I did though, as often as I was up and home for. But in the end, six months after purchase it stopped working. I can guess it was the rain but who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cook

customer_reviews.title: This thing will protect you from Aliens and the Zombie apocalypse.!!!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best bug zapper I have seen since I was a kid in the 80s..... My grandparents always had these bad ass black and decker bug zappers that would fry the crap out of anything... Never again have I seen a store bought zapper of this level. This thing seriously kicks some bug ass. If you buy the new style from your local DIY store they have black lights and hardly zap anything. I'm telling you now, you will not be disappointed with this thing. I will be buying a second and possibly a third if they give me a free one just for my cool review.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bug Zapper!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Flowtron Bug Zapper BK-40D. The first one lasted 4 1/2 years with no problem whatsoever and then it died. We have 1 1/4 acres on our property, so we purchased the one acre bug zapper. It worked great for a long time and then after a thunderstorm it quit. We couldn't be upset, as we definitely got our money's worth out of it. It zapped all kinds of bugs, which made it so much easier to play around the pool and the yard in the evenings, especially when friends and family were over. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality, Cheap Plastic, Arrived Broken Twice!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible product. Cheap plastic. Arrived damaged the first time I ordered it; one of the plastic holes was broken where 1 of 3 screws exists to hold the middle zapper cylinder. I returned it and ordered a replacement. The exact same damage was on the second one that arrived! The box was not damaged either time. The plastic is cheaper!!! Even gently pulling the product out of the shipping box was precarious because the plastic felt so flimsy. Do not waste your time! I am now looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Feely

customer_reviews.title: received 1st one and plugged it into grounded outdoor rated ...
customer_reviews.text: received 1st one and plugged it into grounded outdoor rated extension cord and it dint do anything, tried 3 different outlets and still nothing...sent it back and received a replacement, plugged it directly into a outlet in the garage....it appeared to try and light up and come on , but suddenly went dark, once again tried different outlets to troubleshoot the issue , but still wont come on...........that one is going back also, and have no faith in this product
customer_reviews.author: Norrton

customer_reviews.title: Really Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: When I got mine, the cage was dangling by a single screw, the other two anchor points had been stripped out and broken off, the cage was hitting the bulb. Requested a return immediately after looking at how it is produced. I would not trust to not catch on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these upon recommendation from someone who owned one. The first season it worked well. When I brought it out to use the following year, the light would come on, but the electrical cage had no current (the zapper part broke). I sent it in under warranty and received a new one. It worked well for that season. Now I have taken it out once again as the weather gets hot and the insects come out. It has the same issue. I am planning a move and once I see if I need one in that location, I'll be buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Max Power

customer_reviews.title: Came broken and the boxes were pristine
customer_reviews.text: Not a mark on the outside packing box and not a mark on the inside box. Apparent that the actual product is cheaply built. Two of the three anchor points for the metal electric grid had broken off the plastic top of the unit. The glass bulbs were intact, but the plastic connections broke. Screams CHEAP to me! I will send back and ask for refund. Will look for alternative bug zapper. Moral of the story: $39 is not enough to spend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It simply works
customer_reviews.text: Great choice for controlling insect pests in your backyard. It's very lightweight, almost shockingly light - and the electrical cord is incredibly short - I assume this is some type of product liability reasoning, but other than those two negative comments, I think the bug zapper is excellent. It's has a non-annoying buzz, was super easy to use....simply plug and play. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Packing is poor; received two in a row broken the same way
customer_reviews.text: I gave this two stars, but I can't honestly speak about how it works. Two zappers in a row arrived broken, and they were broken in exactly the same way. There are a bunch of little rings around the bottom of the inner cage that are made of cheap plastic. Sitting on a pole not moving they'd be fine, but in transit they can't take the tumble and toss motion. It needs a simple ring of cardboard inside it to keep it in place. I'm not sure if I'll try a third one or not just because I'm sure the same carrier is going to handle that one that handled the first two.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: If anything this product is entertaining. The most common phrase at my house watching this thing work is Kentucky Fried mosquito . I live in Arizona and we have for some reason flying Daddy Long Legs for mosquitoes. So the cage around it is not very practical. I removed the cage around it and I must say that this thing attracts all kinds of bugs. I am thoroughly satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Soriano

customer_reviews.title: Quick Review- Mosquitoes still feast
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine up for about a month and a half. I leave it running all night long on timer and it shuts off early morning. The mosquitoes are still rampant. My location is the suburbs, nowhere near any lakes or standing water. And I've even had my old pool removed this year. Even after all these days there has been no noticeable difference. It does kill moths by the load which is unfortunate as outdoor moths don't damage me or my garden. In case you were wondering, it attracts a lot of ladybugs, which are bugs gardeners love, and doesn't seem to attract lightening bugs (which I worried about), cause who doesn't love lightning bugs?
customer_reviews.author: EBE

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware of false claim!
customer_reviews.text: So I had high expectations with the 1 acre radius attraction kill claim from what they said. Turned out it only killed maybe 10 bugs at best by day 2. Mostly moths. I haven’t seen any mosquitoes killed which is the main critter it’s supposed to kill. I just don’t feel like I got my money out of it. Have used it for over a week and still expected more out of it. Especially with the amount of flying insects I have around my home here in Hawaii! They falsely advertised this product! Not to mention the few insects actually caught on fire on this lamp and the mosquitoe attraction box doesn’t even stay on right. It’s poorly made!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works ! But.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and a smaller Black Flag. I have 1/2 acre. I don't care what they say....ignore their comments on using one model for up to 1 ac. It definitely doesn't pull all mosquitoes from around my yard just to it!! I will say that the smaller Black Flag seems to be more effective when both are used without the attractant and only using the light. I found this surprising. Since the attractant needs to be replaced so often, knowing it works without it is really beneficial even if it isn't as good. I didn't feel like this product worked as well without the attractant. Both are needed here in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Waited a week for this thing to get here and was super excited to plug it in and watch the annoying bugs take the great lightning ride to the sky. Well once i got an extension cord for the 18in cord it comes with and plugged it in, the WHITE light, not black/UV light it advertises it has flickered for about 20 secs and then nothing. Waste of time. Now i have to return it and order something else. It seems this company used to the one to go to but it appears quality control has been suffering!
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I am struggling to understand these great reviews for this bug zapper. We got this thing to kill Mosquitoes, but, although this thing is excellent at killing moths, it absolutely sucks at killing mosquitoes. Don't waste your money on this for killing mosquitoes, and yes, I DID put the mosquito attractant on the bottom like the instructions said too.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Silanskis

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these on a 0.25 acre lot. I run them for 2 hours during sunrise and sunset hours. I have witnessed it is killing dozens of ladybugs, but I have not seen it is killing any mosquitoes with or without bait. I see mosquitoes flying at 3-ft distance, but not attracted to the light. The bulb and the starter died after a year. This is an expensive experiment, but it does not work. Likewise, I tried sprays (nothing more than a shower; like a joke, they shake up and fly again), smokers and mosquito dunks, which are not effective either. The best protection is a mosquito net so far.
customer_reviews.author: Oktem

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken... twice
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes but it let me down. Ordered one, got here but one of the eyelets that holds the metal cage inside was broken. The cage was loose enough that it touched the bulb. I'm surprised it didn't break. Said fine, I'll get a replacement. Well what do you know... replacement was broken in the exact same way. Pictures are a little blurry but hopefully you can see what I'm talking about. If you do decide to order one just make sure to look where the cage attaches to the top. Hopefully it was just these two.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: These things die almost as quickly as the bugs they kill!
customer_reviews.text: The product works great when they work. This is my fourth one in a year. One I dropped and broke so I will call that my fault. But the others burned out quickly, this last one I got end of March and yesterday it burnt out. In a month! They do kill the bugs, but buying 3 a year is getting ridiculous. I will definitely try to find one that can go for longer. I remember ones we had where they lasted for years. Now that's more like it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R Tillotson

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is Brutal! In A Good Way!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast! Cane in a brown box with no manufacturer packaging but everything looked new so....Hung this under my garage eve to protect it from rain. Garage is 50' behind house and 28' from pool. Wow! We sit on our back patio and just listen to the zapping! Heck,you can hear the zapping from in the house. Totally fried a giant moth,skeeters and we noticed less gnats by patio and pool.This thing is a definate killer! Holes on grating are not as small as some reviewers have stated.Watched some wasps go in and get fried! That was fun! Forget that other name brand one in stores...they do nothing compared to this one. So glad I found this on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: freebird237

customer_reviews.title: Mosquitoes. Definitely works with the attractant!! Never thought I would be able to say that!
customer_reviews.text: It will attract and kill any light loving bugs. I wanted it for mosquitoes though. Mosquitoes are horrible where I live. It does come with a mosquito attracting cartridge which I didn’t notice when I originally bought the zapper (bonus) so I bought an additional one too. I actually added both of them to the bottom. I put one where it goes, then the other one, I sort of put it on top of the original one. They have sticky things that come with them. It works amazing for mosquitoes with those. Never thought I wld be able to say that!
customer_reviews.author: Case

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Received in pieces. I literally had to take it apart and put it back together due to screws not even being put in places they are supposed to be. I found two screws that hold the metal shock grate inside the roofing, so the screws were just loos inside and the metal shock grate was just hanging there also the bulb itself fell out with just moving the item out of the box, I put that back in it’s place after opening the whole item up, it is still extremely loos in there. I am pretty disappointed in this item it seems very cheaply made and put together with zero care. Great product you have here.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can go outside at night!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2018 to try out. I put the Octenol Mosquito Attractant Cartridges in according to the directions. 5 weeks later I had to use a 1/2" paint brush to sweep out the dead bugs stuck to the elements I can now go outside at night without being eaten up! Note: UNPLUG zapper BEFORE attempting to clean!! BTW, you must use Octenol Mosquito Attractant Cartridges to attract the mosquitoes (they're not really drawn to the light) Update: June 2019; It was time to change the Octenol and these pictures should illustrate the results of this zapper. It was about 40 days of "feasting" on insects: mosquitoes, flys, moths, bugs, and even a grasshopper.
customer_reviews.author: harley man

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on southern WI mosquitos.
customer_reviews.text: Placed in an area to attract mosquitos per instructions, but it didn't seem to attract anything....tried varying the height of the lantern to see if it would make a difference to no avail. It's been about a month, so we figure the "attractant" isn't working anymore, but not a single dead mosquito under the lamp. Not sure if the difference is due to different species of mosquitos in different areas, but this didn't work at all for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F.

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy construction
customer_reviews.text: The light arrived with a rattling noise before removal from the box. There was a screw missing from the interior cage around the bulb. The cage was lopsided due to no screw. There continues to be a rattling noise as if something else is not connected. Returning it and hopefully, the replacement will be better assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann Brouillard

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but...
customer_reviews.text: This appears to work great, keeping small bugs out of our house. I can hear it working as soon as I turn it on at night. Only thing is that the one I received had the grid not centered. The grid seemed to be bent toward one direction and I didn't want to chance breaking it by straightening it. Main thing is that works. If it zaps a bigger bug, it can get quite noisy, but usually it's very quiet and all you hear is a quick zap. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DU in Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Good internal design
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these along with two spare bulbs as recommended by the Amazon reviews. It was a good move because one of the units arrived with a bad bulb. Some reviews complained of overheating which is due to the unit staying in a prolonged startup mode that ignites a bulb that will never start. It gave me the opportunity to disassemble the unit to replace the bulb and discover a very thought out design. After the bulb replacement, both units have performed as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Quicksilver

customer_reviews.title: Bulb does not last
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this zapper for less than 2 months, running it only at night. The bulb has already started to fail, or the transformer is going out. I have ordered a replacement bulb. If that doesn't cure the problem then it is the transformer, which is not a replacement item. The bulb is noticeably weaker but still attracts bugs, and the grid still gives a nice snap when a bug gets in. Note that the Features part of the description says it uses a BF-35 bulb (15 watt), but the 1 acre unit uses a BF-190 bulb (40 watt). I have reported this to Amazon but it may take a while to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Death Machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT!!!!!! I live in Florida, about 50 feet from 13 acres of woods, and was being eaten alive every night by every blood sucking flesh eating bug known to man. Hearing those little suckers sizzling on the screen is "almost" as satisfying as listening to bacon sizzling on a campfire. Do yourself and the world a favor and buy this zapper, and start a massacre of your very own. Added bonus, Redbirds love eating up all of the cooked bugs that have fallen off.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Barthlow

customer_reviews.title: Works great in our area
customer_reviews.text: It zaps them all. Even kills mosquitos, which I was skeptical of. It’s cool when a big moth flies in. It’s a slow sizzling death for him. Gets kind of messy around it from the thousands it eliminates every night. But that’s a good thing, it shows it’s working. We use it at a restaurant outside dining area. Area is approx 60 ft x 100 ft. I don’t know if it pulls insects from the surrounding properties. I guess we could ask for ID to see where the bugs came from.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad shipping experience.
customer_reviews.text: This thing destroys any flying bug 🐜 🐛 🕷 that touches the inner metal portion around the bulb. I started using it already (before summer officially started) and it’s killing amazingly 😅. Only reason I’m giving 4 stars ⭐️, is because I had to order a replacement and ship back my first one. The first one had a perfect box, but the actual item was damaged. The metal part that zaps ⚡️ the bugs was “floating” in there. When I turned the box upside down to see what else was rattling, 4 screws and little pieces of broken plastic came out. I suspect during shipping, workers probably threw the box carelessly. Overall awesome appliance 🙌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Chispin Punk

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, Lasted a little over 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and hung them outside hooked to timers that put them on in the evening for 3 hours and early morning hours for @ 2 hours. They worked very well for a little over a year and then quit working. We purchased the additional attracting baits and note they work well with new bait. Looked to change bulbs and when taking them apart, broke the end fittings which are flimsily made. Was disappointed they didn't last longer. Willing to pay more for a durable, effective product if I could find one. Have a little over 2 acres we were trying to make livable here in rural South Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Been Travelling

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to enjoy the yard.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it came intact, easy to unbox and hang, it’s very bright in the outskirts of town, has killed 10’s of thousands of mosquitos already, works extremely well during huge swarms at dusk. Cons: the insecticide package that is included has very low quality adhesive and the underside area where it attaches to is poorly made and mishaped. I found that by just laying the cartridge inside the cage as close as safety allows works even better as it allows more heat to warm the scent tray up. Definitely a great purchase. 200-300 bugs at a time being zapped per minute is a good product when living down wind of a cattle farm.
customer_reviews.author: Pam K

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 ever
customer_reviews.text: Yard was overwhelmed with insects. Tried every spray and pellet, they only lasted until the next rainstorm then the kids would come in eaten alive. Put this up one afternoon, added the mosquito attractant. Withing 24hrs we had a mound of dead insects under the device. Withing 48hrs there were no insects in the backyard. Kids are able to play outside without being doused in chemical repellents.
customer_reviews.author: M. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Works great for killing the Minnesota state bird which is the mosquito. lol
customer_reviews.text: Now, this is a bug killer. I've purchased several other brands, one from QVC that's a waste of money. This is the best one on the market. I live in Minnesota,and I hooked this up, very easy, and in one night there were probably 200 to 300 dead bugs, flies, mosquito, gnats, moths, etc. I use the attraction pads,they work good. Easy to do just peel and stick the pad on the bottom and your good to go. This is a very effective device. If the sound of bugs getting zapped bothers you, then you would need to mount it far enough away that you cannot hear it. Very good item, I love it
customer_reviews.author: JG (Highflyer)Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I guess I bought a “NEW” return!
customer_reviews.text: Well, it looks like I bought somebody’s RETURN. Dusty right out of the box. I assumed it was from the box. Further inspection, you can see wipe marks. Mosquitos are not even attracted to UV light I found out. They seem to always be sold out so watch out you’re probably gonna get a return. Ughhhhhhh the bug problems. This light just attracts more to be honest. Probably going to be returned again!
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: It is not a black light - it is a UV light
customer_reviews.text: We were hoping to replace our Stinger black light unit with this Flowtron. In one section of the description it says it is a high intensity UV light, but in the bullet points, it says it is a UV (Black Light). So I bought it. It's just a high intensity UV light. When you are wearing something white, it doesn't make it glow in the dark light a black light would do. Unfortunately, this is such a bright bluish white light that it interferes with the infrared on my security cameras. So, I wish I could return it but I threw out the box and there are dead moths in the unit now.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieB

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: Thing works great all you hear is zapping. Do not recommend putting near where you are hanging out since the bright light attracts the bugs so well but man it works great. The price is right, seems like a well built unit. It is plastic so should handle the elements well. I hate mosquitos and it comes with a 30 day attractant pad. We have not gotten into the real warm weather yet but with all the rain we are getting this year expecting a higher than usual mosquito population this summer. Nothing better than the sound of a sizzling mosquito..........................
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Performance!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of being eaten alive by mosquitoes every time I stepped out into my backyard so I decided to purchase the electronic insect killer. I hung it on the outer edge of my patio and within minutes it began to do its job and within days I no longer had a mosquito problem! This product also comes with an optional octenal pack for added use. I recommend it because I feel it Attracts more insects! Aside from the zapping sound from the insects it is very quiet and gives out a soft luminous glow to your lighted area. Shipping was exceptionally prompt! I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Avila

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about six weeks and then died
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years. They normally last about two seasons then the circuit board fails and the bulb will not switch on. This year, we decided to buy two of the smaller models instead of the large ones. One of them lasted about six weeks then died In the usual way. Not going to order them anymore Will purchase a different brand from the local hardware store instead.
customer_reviews.author: bubbadog

customer_reviews.title: Killing bugs
customer_reviews.text: Had I done proper research and known that the attractant was supposed to be replaced once a month at about $10 a shot I would not have bought the thing. Edit 6-1-20. Glad I bought it now. It's killing the heck out of bugs, especially mosquitoes and I seem to have an abundance of them this year. Will just have to grit my teeth and drop $10 a month. Like it enough that I ordered the model 80 today.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Payne

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Twice.
customer_reviews.text: The product did not turn on upon receiving it. I contacted the manufacturer who knew immediately what the problem was because (I suspect) the problem is chronic. They mailed me a new bulb starter, but installation instructions were useless. After YouTubing what others have tried, I installed the bulb but was still unable to get this useless product to turn on. This is as close to a scam as I can think. If your product doesn't work so often, either you are in the wrong business or your engineers are just lazy. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: AllenA

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly effective... and fun. Zap zap
customer_reviews.text: It's mosquito season here in Wyoming, and it's a doozy. I decided to fight back against the little blood sucking devils. So I did some comparison shopping, and a lot of reading. This bug killer is at the top of several lists. And I can see why. Zappity Zap Zap! It arrived well packaged with no breakage. (A big problem here) It's a breeze to use. Just plug it in. The bulb light attracts bugs at night. And there's a scent attractant with it (replaceable) to keep working in daylight. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: kmk

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: We are at southern Indiana and no luck with this at all. Added 5 baits at a time (2 different kinds, the original plus one more after few days) and there is very little impact. I added it to an area of the yard that has tons of them and I expected this to be much better just by them flying around in that are. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: It just works don’t think about it it works
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a mosquito problem do you have a bug problem things that fly and you can’t see but they’re there oh this thing will find them somewhere somehow this light attracts them wheels man like a fish and then zap the dead instantly don’t be afraid if you hear crackling and popping like mini fireworks that’s exactly how it sounds miniature fireworks love it love it just love it
customer_reviews.author: jessie Martinez.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. One month in and it's working with no issues, especially after a hail storm, 4 rains, and 4 dust storms.
customer_reviews.author: wys99backup

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t attract or kill bugs
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this product for two simple reasons. First, it doesn’t do what it’s supposed to do. We didn’t notice any drop in mosquito activity, even with the attractant. We still got bit like crazy, even right near this. And there weren’t a ton of bugs in there to clean, even after a month. Second, it made our electric bill go from $200 a month to $640 in one month. It took us a while to figure it out. We had it constantly plugged in hoping it would kill bugs and immediately unplugged it upon figuring that out. This was not a win for us.
customer_reviews.author: j james

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging. Lights arrive broken! Don't do it.
customer_reviews.text: Giant issue with the mounts that hold the electric grate in place! I ordered 2 and both arrived broken from shipping. There are 3 screws that hold the grate onto the light itself. I imagine poor packaging let the light move around during shipping and broke 2 of the 3 on one light and all 3 on the other. Leaving the product totally useless 😡. Attached picture shows how we rigged it with zip ties just to get it workable.... Still haven't fixed 2nd light yet.... I would not recommend... Does kill bugs tho if you can fix yours or it actually works out of the box🤣
customer_reviews.author: beverly j sanders

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The zapping is a bit loud, my small dog is scared of the sound and will not go outside if it is on. Not much you can do about that though. It is strong and works very well. It is very hard to clean. Needs to be sold with some sort of cleaning tool. I am Not sure what to use, and within a week it is covered with burnt moths, and smokes a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Anders

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it worked fine for a couple of months. Then the fluorescent bulb starts to loosen up that a little wind and the prong slips right off . While the mosquito is out there supposedly getting zap but instead feeding on me while I'm trying to push this fluorescent tube back in place. I've done that for a few nights now and fed up with it. I bought one for 1/2 acre of the same brand and that one never gave me any problem.
customer_reviews.author: hellosmiley

customer_reviews.title: Killed them ground hornets dead... yeehaw
customer_reviews.text: Tried flooding them out... tried hot and cold water... soapy water... coudn't use bug spray by the veg-ee-tables And if I used gasoline I prolly woulda burned down my hass. Put this glowee thang ontop of that there ground hornet nest... and boy, they were more peeved than a hound dog watchin a tennis match... a trex at a typerwriter convention... or a millenial without the internet. I filled in that nest the next day. Perfect like an ice cold Pabst.
customer_reviews.author: steepens

customer_reviews.title: Totally Useless
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Totally ineffective against giant sized mosquitoes. The mosquitoes in our area are huge. See the video. This means that the grill spacing is too small to let them in. Secondly even after I cut a large hole in the grill to let the mosquitoes in, the Flowtron totally failed to attract any of them in. I did use the Octenol lure which I stuck to the bottom of the Flowtron per the directions. I did not see a SINGLE mosquito zapped or killed. I saw some other smaller bugs and even a moth that was zapped but the mosquitoes were not attracted to the flowtron at all.
customer_reviews.author: PaulArt

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Received on right time and package was well protected. Quality is good. Value for money spend. Its my Received on right time and package was well protected. Quality is good. Value for money spend. Its my 2nd year I have been using this. No issues so far. I do recommend this sincerely. Appreciate much if you could provide a response if you feel this review is helpful. I’m trying to be honest in my review. 2nd year I have been using this. No issues so far. I do recommend this sincerely. Appreciate much if you could provide a response if you feel this review is helpful. I’m trying to be honest in my review.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my 1/2 acre flowtron
customer_reviews.text: Brought this after my 1/2 acre died with 3 years of use of awesome mosquitoe killing. so thought I'd go to a bigger mosquitoe killer but to my suprise it did not kill a single mosquito. but i did get a beetle!.requested a replacement and it did not do any better. finally returned and got the 1/2 acre and its great 2 nights and screen is half way full will probably rinse in a few days
customer_reviews.author: Checkout

customer_reviews.title: Beware of cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I ordered.this and the first time it was damaged. There are.three screws that go into plastic holes that hold up the metal coil all three were broken. I thought ok I will just send it back get another one. And that one was the same way. Either they have no idle how to pack this.product or they use cheap plastic to hold up something that could use more work. We ended up going to Walmart and buying another brand. I will never get this product again.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bug zapper.
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews however I have to for this bug zapper. It works amazing. And it's pretty entertaining to when a large morh flies in. It was full by the morning with a pile of bugs underneath it. I hit it lightly with the leaf blower and it cleaned right out. If you have bugs, buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Much, much better than my last unit
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked this up to replace my old Stinger brand bug zapper. It's frying bugs up like crazy! The old one was noticeably dimmer, and I never heard it actually zapping bugs. It did kill some, but this Flowtron unit is at least 4x brighter and has an audible zapping sound every time a bug hits it. I mounted on my backyard fence, across from the sliding glass door. Before, at night, bugs would be on the glass door but I've been outside for 30 minutes and not a bug near me! The sound of frying bugs might annoy my neighbors (I don't know yet) but I love this unit! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JGM

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing! Just sitting on the deck and watching it blast those obnoxious bugs! Does a good job keeping most of the bugs away as long as you follow the directions. Also, you MUST clean it when it gets really dirty or it won’t work. Luckily, it’s super easy to open up and clean. You just need a screwdriver and a toothbrush. Would not recommend using your personal toothbrush. Maybe use somebody’s that you don’t like. Could be vindicating.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hendon

customer_reviews.title: Now we know what happened to Mothra
customer_reviews.text: Yeah. This thing is kind of like science fiction. It arrived yesterday. I didn't have a way to hang in over the back porch just yet, so I just set it on the cocktail table. I plugged it in to an extension cord about sunset. In 90 minutes it was cooking moths like a fireworks finale. This morning I vacuumed up what must have been a thousand moths, not all dead but definitely attracted to the zapper. I put one in the 2400 square foot hangar, the idea being to deny a food source to the bats. Take that, Mothra.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Florey

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time returned due to exact same piece broken
customer_reviews.text: 1st item ordered: arrived with a piece broken making it impossible to use the item. Returned it. 2nd order arrived with the same pice broken, but the item is usable...I kept it because I was desperate for a bug zapper for that evening. I wanted to order a 2nd one for the other side of my yard. The 3rd time ordered the item arrived with the same pice broken! Returned it again and will not be purchasing fro this company agin,
customer_reviews.author: tlp

customer_reviews.title: Great Bug Light To Keep Termite Swarms Away From House
customer_reviews.text: I live in the deep south in a wooded neighborhood. Every year in May and June the termites swarm and even the best sealed houses get them inside. I have windows all across the back of my house, and they try to get inside. I purchased this light, and put it about 30 feet away from the back of my house, now I have no issues. They are attracted to the bug light and not my house. The next day after a swarm, I just use my blower to blow the dead ones off the light and I am ready for the next swarm.
customer_reviews.author: DresdenDog

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple months ago and I am completely satisfied. I have a half acre lot in a rural area. When I purchased the property, the pests were terrible, even in the day. My neighbors are even impressed in how much difference it has made over the season. The grandchildren go out and play until sundown with no issues. I just hose it off each day as it is covered in dead bugs. I spray straight or down to keep the water from spraying up into the electronics. I followed the recommendations from the manufacturer for placement and I am thinking of getting second one for the other side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great but dangerous for the mantids
customer_reviews.text: I had two mantids take station outside the grill to get some quick food. But another flew into the machine and got fried. I haven't had this going very long but it is covered with dead insects, and it zaps constantly. I decided to switch from Stinger, 1/2 acre model to this 1 acre model, 15W to 40W. It's a large and clunky machine, but gets the job done. It keeps the insects out of my house even! I hope it lasts longer than the Stinger once the weather gets to it.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: It does kill moths.  Mosquitos?....meh
customer_reviews.text: Shipment was very fast. Setup was simple. Item itself is well made and capable of lasting many summers. However, I am not finding that this attracts and kills mosquitos or even flies. I never realize how many moths I have in my yard until I started using this. Every morning I find a mound of dead winged moths piled up below the Flowtron. Once I turn the device off in the morning small birds fly up and pick off dead bugs for their dinner. They are smart enough to avoid it when it's turned on. I was really hoping that this machine would rid me of mosquitos and biting gnats but in this instance it's an epic fail.
customer_reviews.author: Gluhwein

customer_reviews.title: Not a mosquito killer!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not sure this insect killer works at all!! Even purchasing extra (expensive) cartridges and changing them out, moving the "lantern" around to different spots...nothing seems to work killing mosquito's' or flying ants. I hope this wasn't a complete waste of my money and time. It looks like it's back to DEET!!!
customer_reviews.author: stjohnaubrey

customer_reviews.title: Does not work  “new out of the box “
customer_reviews.text: Pretty excited to try out our new zapper ! However turned it on and bugs are Flying in and out of it without getting zapped . We are pretty disappointed . Now we have to return it and wait for a new one . Very inconvenient
customer_reviews.author: Tom Amato

customer_reviews.title: Zapping off June beetles!!
customer_reviews.text: We hung up string lights on our back patio and the first night we turned them on we were attacked by June beetles!! They were dive bombing us nonstop!! We decided to give the Flowtron a try and so far we love it! It was very easy to hang up and “install”. It has done an awesome job at zapping any insects that are lured into its trap! As for “noise level” it’s really no different than any other zapper. We don’t mind the noise and zapping as long as we can enjoy our patio!!
customer_reviews.author: Ilissa

customer_reviews.title: Zapper is fine.  Packaging stinks.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive my Flowtron Bug Zapper. It arrived via UPS the day before our annual family BBQ. When I picked up the box from the front porch, it rattled ominously. Upon opening the carton, a stream of plastic fragments, sheet metal screws, and other debris pored out. There was hardly any packing material in the box, and it had obviously been tossed about in shipping. I put it back together with crazy glue, machine screws, nuts and washers, and it works fine. Since I think my repair is stronger than the original construction, I won’t be returning the item, but i would strongly suggest the company re-examine their shipping procedures. Deducting two stars for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: A R Platt

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We used this near our front porch and it stopped working ... I did exhaustive research and read reviews and though this was the one to use .. but it would seem the cage for the "zapping" part will no longer work after a time .... i am not sure if it is fixable .. the only thing working now is the light .. drawing bugs to look at it ... :( .. but I am very upset .... I worked wonderfully until it did not ... we cleaned it up thinking that was the issue .. but no ... sigh!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Collins

customer_reviews.title: shipped broken
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Flowtron today via UPS. The box was very battered so I wasn't surprised that there was a broken plastic where a screw normally holds the wire grid in place. I have one of these Flowtrons I bought last year and it is still working great. I would have liked to give this 5 stars, but after checking the box onside and out and shaking it upside down, there was no broken plastic or screw in the box. In other words it was placed broken in the box at the factory. I took a piece of coated wire and was able to straighten and hold the wire grid in place and it is working.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Damaged one is shipped to me
customer_reviews.text: A damaged one is sent to me. The metal net is hanged on plastic parts. The plastic part is already broken when I received it. Hopefully, the replacement should be OK.
customer_reviews.author: ChemGuy

customer_reviews.title: Any ideas?
customer_reviews.text: Much to my dismay, this thing doesn't seem to kill flies. Well, I'm sure it WOULD kill flies, if it would first ATTRACT flies. Or the flies in my hood are supremely smart. Either way, they're laughing at me for the amount of money I'm investing into getting rid of them. If anyone has suggestions on how to make flies flock to this darn thing, I'm all ears. I've actually considered hanging a bag of dog poop under the lamp, but with my luck and these flies' intelligence, they'd just figure out how to get in the bag and bypass the lamp.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: excellent kill-rate even without attractant.
customer_reviews.text: We plugged this light in and after two 12 hour shifts it was completely covered in carcasses, not to mention all the smaller ones that had fallen to the ground. That is without using any attractant. We mostly got gnats and moths. Using the attractant is supposed to increase the biting insect's killed, but haven't tried it yet as it is recommended to place it 25 feet away from human activity zones. Yes it does make a zapping noise when the insects hit it, but that is to be expected. Its outer housing is plastic. We will have to wait to see how durable it is.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but was hoping for better build quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems to do the job but the construction feels a little cheap and plastic...there’s also not an on/off switch so I had to attach to a power strip. I hung this from a tree about 50 feet away from the back door. I put a bowl of water under it to see what it was zapping and it definitely takes out a good number of flying insects in my yard...there are noticeably fewer flies and mosquitoes so all in all I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lipman

customer_reviews.title: Bugpocalypse
customer_reviews.text: When I started using this I left it on a flat surface in my back porch because I had nowhere to hang it from. After a week I found that there was a small mountain of dead bugs at the base of this zapper. I should try mounting this above my Koi pond so I'll never have to feed them. I don't know whether 5 stars on noise level is supposed to represent the quietness of it or the satisfaction of hearing the electrical pop when a bug is obliterated, but it's quiet when not killing bugs, and it's satisfyingly loud when killing bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Renchan

customer_reviews.title: Not for flies!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a fly problem. It claims to attract and kill flies. After attaching the attractant, I placed it directly over my chest freezer for a week, so I could see the fried carcasses. During the day it killed nothing. Not a single fly. Worked great at night as expected. Attracted and killed all sorts of bugs that have never bothered me.I So... For moths and mosquitoes it works great. For flies, not at all.
customer_reviews.author: poindexterous

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Day one: I live out in the country, bugs are big and not hard to come by. It’s still light enough that I can see the bugs flying to it. They are begging to flock. “Zap, zap, zap!” Every time! The thing came with mosquito attractant- I will try it when the bugs get worse- it’s still early in the season. It makes that constant “electrical buzz” between zaps... I don’t personally mind. I think it just got a mosquito on its own!!! I like this one.... I don’t have another to compare it to- but it’s doing what I bought it for! I said 5 star on cleaning because I’m pretty sure it’ll be easy.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole D Loso-Velez

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs dont last
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I purchased this March 26, 2019. It is now May 17, 2019. Not even 2 months of owning. The bulb is barely lit now but is still zapping. It will need a new bulb I'm assuming. Going down to 2 stars. I think I'm done with Flowtron. I have owned this brand before. I decided to try it out again but with the smaller version. I'm hoping it will last a few seasons. but with my last Flowtron zapper, I had to replace the bulbs every season and had to replace 2 bulb starters before it finally stopped working all together and I just threw it out. Hoping I get better life out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: ZAP! ZAP! BZZZZZ! SNAP!
customer_reviews.text: Music to my ears! I bought 2 of these and the sound of those little bloodsuckers getting cooked to a crisp is the most satisfying thing I've ever heard! This design is so much easier to clean than the fantastic plastic garbage I bought last year from menards, a quick squirt with the garden hose gets the job done in seconds! This unit has the power to burn through stuck-on bugs, unlike most others out there that quickly short out and completely stop working after one night.
customer_reviews.author: HeathFX

customer_reviews.title: Fire HAZARD!!!! Dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item, and the thought of someone plugging it in and walking away is a seriously scary thought!!! Not only did this not help with the mosquitoes, the only thing actually attracted to it moths which were the moths, caught actual fire! We heard the zap and seen it turn into a flame! Had we not immediately unplugged this item, it would have quickly turned into a serious fire! This is truly A dangerous item that should not be used!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Work well for one season, then die
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought three of these and while they worked well for a year or so, two died after 1 season and the third died after 2 seasons. I bought these to replace other brands, but those brands lasted 5+ years and were the same size with the same 40w bulb. During the Michigan winter they were unplugged and stored in a cold but sealed shed. Come springs, I plug them in and they are dead - either the bulb won't light (yes tried a new bulb) or they don't zap anymore. So pick another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Green

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This bug zapper is larger than I thought it was going to be but I'll still use it. My neighborhood is surrounded by woods and when it's warm, the gnats come out. I've only lived here since April and have only seen a couple of mosquitoes. Flies get in occasionally. It's the gnats I can't stand though. They fly around my face and land on my computer screen. Ugh so annoying! I can't give this zapper five stars because the cord on it is extremely short AND, no bottom tray to catch dead bugs. I have to use this thing inside my house.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: FREEDOM!
customer_reviews.text: I grill on my deck. I live near the woods. The bugs and I have been at war since I was a wee child. Along comes Flowtron to literally nuke the entire insect population on our property. The zapper is in our woods right outside my window. It lulls me to sleep each night with the sound of it mercilessly frying those buzzy little bastards to death. I can finally grill, do yard work, and generally exist in peace thanks to my Flowtron BX-40D. Thing is wicked awesome.
customer_reviews.author: JSplaine62

customer_reviews.title: best product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Recently after the rain, mosquitoes are everywhere. I was not able to open the door without having some fly inside the house. Pest control services would not do anything to help with the issue, so i bought 4 of these for my 10000sqft lot. Its zapping on overtime and works very well. At first i thought the zapper was malfunctioning because all i could hear was continous zapping noise. When i took a look out the window, i could not believe it. The zapper was surrounded by mosquitos and zapping like crazy. I could see smoke coming off of the zapper.
customer_reviews.author: janice

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in absolute disbelief that the mosquito problem is this bad! We have tried everything!! (Every bug spray chemical & natural, Fogging multiple times, burning all kinds of bug repellents chemical & natural, garlic, ACV, essential oils.) This is years of problem solving and still getting eaten alive when we are outside. Even in the daytime. This bug zapper is AMAZING!! The picture is the pile of bugs that were attached to the zapper lights after being on two nights for literally an hour or so each night. We look forward to getting more!
customer_reviews.author: Shika

customer_reviews.title: Showed up with 3 loose screws
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to give this a 1 star, just because after about 10 minutes of disassembly and reassembly, I had the Flowtron working. However, I can't give it more than a 2 star because I had to disassemble the whole thing to screw in the three loose screws that were supposed to secure the inner, electrified metal grid to the chasis of the unit. Still not sure it will do the job, but at least the bulb came on when I plugged it in. Rather kind of shocked Amazon would fulfill this order with the loose screws being very easy to hear in the sealed box... in fact, thought it was simply broken even before opening the box.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett B.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful zapper, good for suburbs. High quality.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the burbs so I was concerned after reading some reviews that said it was excessively bright. But I have found that it is as bright as I expected. My setup is a 12’x14’ deck off the back of the house with cafe lights overhead. Then I have grass in the yard behind, about 20’x20’. I put the light about 10’ past the deck and it is completely fine. You can definitely hear when the bugs get zapped but it’s not excessive. I’m the 1st one to get bit all the time in the yard but the 2 times I’ve used this so far, no bites! Haven’t had to clean anything yet either, looks brand new still.
customer_reviews.author: GJMdesign

customer_reviews.title: Warranty not great after product failure
customer_reviews.text: The product failed. Contacted the warranty department. Received some wires and a bulb to do my own a home repair. Not quite the customer service one would expect. I expected a replacement, and instead got an at home science project.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year
customer_reviews.text: Had it less than a year and all I have now blue light. It isn’t killing anything because the grid isn’t electrified anymore.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wash

customer_reviews.title: Cheap one tube light mosquito zapper
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap one AC mosquito killer but IT ONLY COME WITH ONE LIGHT INSTEAD OF TWO TUBE LIGHTS LIKE THE ONE I BOUGHT LONG TIME AGO THAT WHY IT COST 49 dollars cheap but I think it work the same it just don’t produce that much light or save electricity
customer_reviews.author: Joe Houston

customer_reviews.title: Works..but
customer_reviews.text: It is a very bright blue light and lights up the yard, but we put a decretive flag up to block the very bright blue light from reaching the porch where we sit. . My other zappers use a much calmer very dark purple. It zaps some pretty big moths so we are putting a netting around it so as larger moths cannot get in. Fills up fast. There is no day/night sensor. I did put my own on. Nit picking? Not sure. But it does zap everything that gets inside, including some large exotic moths.
customer_reviews.author: kathnrich

customer_reviews.title: Works well in Maryland swamp
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this zapper for the last four summers and it is great. The pile of insect carcasses is impressive each morning. Used in conjunction with a mosquito coil I can comfortably sit out at night with no issues. Taking it apart to clean at the end of the season is a bit of a pain, and it is hard to get sandpaper on the electrodes without damaging the insulators. Other then that is is really good and effective
customer_reviews.author: chet brewer

customer_reviews.title: I’m sure other may have had success.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this is over my trash cans - lots of flies as you can imagine (summer time) added the bait to the bottom per directions. Had it on for 72 hours .......... I think it got rid of 5 or 6 bugs..... returned......purchased the hanging fly bags ( the type you fill with water) bag was full of flies in 3 days......now I keep a Thompson sprayer with a 50/50 mix outdoor bleach and water —— spray trash cans and area about every 3-4 days..... almost all the little buggers hang out at my neighbors homes instead...
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment- and it keeps bugs away
customer_reviews.text: My family jokes that this is the best entertainment we’ve found for $40! Maybe we’re just twisted but there’s something satisfying about listening to a steady hum of zaps from gnats, or a long zap from a larger bug and the smell of burned bug wafting your way after... Seriously though - it’s amazing the difference this makes keeping bugs away from our doors and windows at night. Wish I’d bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: 100’s of RIP moths.
customer_reviews.text: Well.. it came fast. Nice boxing. Not made like they used too. Plastic. Plugged it in and the zapping began! So many moths came to it within seconds. The zapping stopped. Maybe shorted it out. Unplugged it. Plugged back in and held it as I had it sitting on a table. Seemed to work better hanging. Woke up to a HUGE pile of dead moths. Pleased. The mesquiteo attractant wasn’t easy to understand how to insert.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long!
customer_reviews.text: We love this bug zapper. It works great! However we bought this in mid May. Didn’t get around to installing it until July and by September it stopped working. I can’t figure out who to contact. My husband think maybe we need a new bulb but a replacement bulb is $20. That get expensive to replace the bulb every 2-3 months! So it is a great bug zapper while it worked but sadly it didn’t last long!
customer_reviews.author: Happydays

customer_reviews.title: This is the bug Catcher to get- read the review!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and works! I highly recommend this unit to everyone! We have bought this one for years and the bulbs are replaceable. The only reason we had to replace the whole unit was because the whole unit got hit by high winds and fell to the ground and shattered completely. It attracts all the bugs, but for the 🐝 bees people, I’ve not seen any bees or beneficial bugs get caught up in there!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Not WaterProof, Shorted out in the Rain !!
customer_reviews.text: As far as bugs works great ... 3 stars because it shorted on the rain an tripped the outlet !!! If it’s made to be outside, it should Not short in the rain !!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Ray Rivera

product_meta.title: Flowtron BK-40D Electronic Insect Killer, 1 Acre Coverage,Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Size:1 acre coverage| Style:FlowtronFlow Tron electronic insect killer sanitize-blight eliminates thousands of insect pests daily,insect traps. Improves the health and quality of life by reducing the spread of infectious diseases sound generators and decreasing the annoyance level caused by flying insect pests. 2-year limited . Power Source: Electric, Material Type: Polycarbonate, Product Type: Bug zapper, Coverage: 1 acre, UL Listed: Yes, Assembly Required: No, Dimensions L x W x H (in. ): 9 3/4 x 9 3/4 x 16 1/2, Removal Of: Flying insect, Indoor/Outdoor Use: Outdoor, Compatible With: Octane cartridges,animal repellent decoys.

AMAZON.COM
Flowtron's lantern-style insect killer uses nontoxic ultraviolet light to eliminate mosquitoes, biting flies, and other insects over a 1-acre area. The insect killer is cleaner and safer than its chemical counterparts, and its patented nonclogging killing grid eliminates the grid clogging that can short-circuit the unit or cause flare-ups of insect remains. The insect killer features high-impact construction and a protective outer enclosure to prevent children, pets, birds, or wildlife from contacting the charged grid.
feature_bullets: Advanced Electronic Insect Control,ultraviolet(UV) light units

1 Acre Killing Radius, 40-Watt Bulb,the cord is 9” in length,insect traps. Place the unit 25 away from the area intended for human activity. Position the insect killer between the source of insects (woods,lowlands, etc.) and the area to be protected
Non Clogging Killing Grid. Repel-pesticides, assembled unit size- 9-3/4 Inch L. x 9-3/4 Inch W x 16-1/2 H
Instantaneous Operation,insect traps,continuous and Uninterrupted Service.
This product is for outdoor use only.Animal repellent decoys.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars7,552 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
